content: The Seattle Mariners designated veteran Tommy La Stella for assignment on Tuesday to open a roster spot for top pitching prospect Bryce Miller.

La Stella, 34, was batting .190 with one extra-base hit and two RBIs in 12 games for the Mariners this season. In 10 major league seasons with six different teams, La Stella is a .266 hitter with 40 home runs and 206 RBIs in 679 games.Miller, 24, was set to make his major league Tuesday night against the Oakland Athletics. He was off to a rocky start at Double-A Arkansas, going 0-2 with a 6.41 ERA in four starts. The fourth-round pick by Seattle in 2021 is 7-6 with a 3.65 ERA in 36 minor league appearances (33 starts).--Field Level Media
